required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Preliminary Efficacy Study of GX-I7 in Patients With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1b Study to Investigate the Safety and Preliminary Efficacy of GX-I7 in Patients With COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a phase 1b clinical trial to investigate the safety and preliminary effects of a single dose of a test drug or placebo to the subjects who has diagnosed as COVID-19 infection.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is a phase 1b clinical trial to investigate the safety and preliminary effects of a single dose of a test drug or placebo to the subjects who has diagnosed as COVID-19 infection.
Study design: prospective, randomized, placebo-controlled, single-blind, single-center

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate, characteristics, and severity of adverse reactions
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety of GX-I7 in patients with COVID-19 (rating according to NCI CTCAE v5.0)

primary_outcome.measure: Shift from baseline of vital sign
primary_outcome.description: The number of patients in vital sign shifted from normal or abnormal (NCS) to abnormal (CS)

primary_outcome.measure: Shift from baseline of physical examination
primary_outcome.description: The number of patients in physical examination shifted from normal or abnormal (NCS) to abnormal (CS)
The number of patients in hematology shifted from normal or abnormal (NCS) to abnormal (CS)

primary_outcome.measure: Shift from baseline of blood chemistry
primary_outcome.description: The number of patients in blood chemistry shifted from normal or abnormal (NCS) to abnormal (CS)

secondary_outcome.description: The change of absolute lymphocyte count from baseline
To evaluate the efficacy of GX-I7 in patients with COVID-19

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of clinical improvement by modified early warning score (MEWS)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes of modified early warning score (MEWS) from the baseline after the IP administration [Low-risk (score 0) ~ high-risk (score 3)]

secondary_outcome.measure: Ordinal scale for clinical improvement (WHO) in each visit
secondary_outcome.description: Changes of ordinal scale for clinical improvement (WHO) from the baseline after the IP administration [Uninfected 0 ~ Dead 8]

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects who have progressed to death or a critical illness
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of GX-I7 in patients with COVID-19
Changes in the rate of different immune cell types and regulatory T cell in the blood after the IP administration

intervention.description: Formulation buffer of recombinant human interleukin-7 hybrid Fc

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects who have been confirmed to be COVID-19 corresponding to mild cases of severity categorization classified by FDA through polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test or virus gene test (sequencing) and who can be available to be administered within seven days from the date of manifestation.
2. Subjects who are or will be inpatient.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with symptoms of moderate or higher in the severity classification presented by FDA have evidence of lower respiratory tract infection in their imaging findings or need supplemental oxygen therapy or mechanical respiration (ie, non-invasive ventilation, invasive mechanical ventilation, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, etc)
2. Subjects with infectious diseases such as bacteremia or severe pneumonia requiring active treatment within four weeks prior to the IP administration
